channel.title: CVE Feed for Palantir -- sls-logging
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Palantir -- sls-logging

item.title: CVE-2022-48308|2024-08-03T15:10:59.729Z -- palantir -- sls-logging
item.description: It was discovered that the sls-logging was not verifying hostnames in TLS certificates due to a misuse of the javax.net.ssl.SSLSocketFactory API. A malicious attacker in a privileged network position could abuse this to perform a man-in-the-middle attack. A successful man-in-the-middle attack would allow them to intercept, read, or modify network communications to and from the affected service.
